intro: Monnina confusa, commonly known as the paleleaf monnina, is a herbaceous perennial native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often colorful flowers. The plant features slender, upright stems with opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. Its small, pink to red flowers are clustered in dense, bracted inflorescences, often appearing in late spring to early summer. Monnina confusa is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a hardy plant suitable for xeriscaping and native gardens.
